benchmark_details.name: PEARL (Persona and knowledgE Augmented Recommendation diaLogues)
benchmark_details.overview: PEARL is a large-scale conversational recommendation dataset synthesized with persona- and knowledge-augmented LLM simulators, containing over 57,000 dialogues to address limitations of existing datasets in expressing user preferences and providing explanations for recommendations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive dataset for developing conversational recommender systems that emphasize personalized recommendations and user preferences.

data.source: Real-world movie reviews collected from IMDB.
data.annotation: Synthesized using persona and knowledge from LLM-based simulators.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated through comparisons between dialogues from PEARL and existing datasets, as well as performance of downstream models trained on PEARL.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in conversational recommendation tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared performance of models trained on PEARL versus models trained on ReDial and INSPIRED.
methodology.validation: Evaluation through human assessments and automatic metrics.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Filtering mechanisms are applied to avoid personal information and maintain user privacy.
